column4: Hello, i just installed ubuntu 10.04, now my onbord network card doesnt work for some reason, and if i dual boot to 11.04 or windows 7 it doesnt work either, i checked cable and changed it but doesnt help
nope desktop and it's the wired network
make sure its not disabled in bios
its not i was online 20 min ago, then i booted on to the cd and installed BAM no net since
i can see the netcard in ethtool lshw etc. but it wont regonise that it has a cable in it
the fact that it don't work in windows either is weird also
indead my sound also went, also in windows but nwm that got usb soundcard for that, but netcard is important
here's all the info on the machine and netcard http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=11139756
I have never had a network card not work with any Linux install in the last 5 years
well i had 11.04 yesterday and it worked fine there and in windows, i just wanted back to 10.04 lts and then this happen
any power surges or lightning strikes around anywhere?
can you borrow a card from someone to try out?
sadly not, gonna have to buy one then
Are you connecting to a router, if so does the router work for other machines?
i'm connected to a switch and then a router and it works for other computers in the household
just a thought because my Comcast connected router gets a migraine and I have to give it a total reset wwith a toothpick in the hole
the link wont come up, can't even go to the intranet to my serverethtool says link is down
